page.title: 04THE AERODROME
page.content: In 1940 the old aerodrome was used as an airforce base.It is on the outskirts of Scorton village.Fighter planes based there were used in night raids to prevent German aircraft from bombing Teesside and Catterick Garrison.The planes stationed at the aerodrome were Beaufighters.These had twin engines and were armed with two cannons and eight machine guns. In and around Scorton there are six smaller sites.Some,near the aerodrome, were places for repairing aircraft and machinery.Some sites were where the airmen lived.On the site next to our school there was an Officers' Mess,a Sergeants' Mess,a decontamination centre and a gymnasium.The concrete bases of the huts are still there, and the gymnasium is used by the Grammar School boys.
